document_data.name: Xonthal
document_data.mainbody: '''Xonthal''' was an adventurer [[mage]] from [[Faerûn]] that traveled the breadth of [[Toril]], visiting the continents of [[Zakhara]], [[Kara-Tur]], and [[Maztica]] across the [[Trackless Sea]], and eventually became a powerful and famous [[archmage]].
document_data.Personality: The mage was a solitary person that greatly valued his privacy and solitude.
document_data.Abilities:
He was famous for being the first [[Faerûn]]ian mage to become a [[plumaweaver]], the practitioners of [[feather magic]] that was unique to the lands of Maztica. His arcane studies centered around the the [[school of magic|school]] of [[conjuration]] as well as [[elemental magic|elemental]] [[evocation]].

Xonthal also spent some amount of time looking into [[chronomancy|time-altering magic]]. Within his tower he kept two man-sized hourglasses that were built to potentially [[time travel|manipulate or alter the time stream]].
document_data.Activities: Through his years of magical experimentation, Xonthal sought to incorporate the most desirable features of elementals from various planes and combine them within a single being.
document_data.Relationships: Xonthal could often be found traveling alongside [[genie]]s and [[elemental|other beings]] from the [[elemental planes]].
document_data.History:
The aspiring spellcaster began his illustrious career as a simple [[adventurer]].

At some point, Xonthal decided to construct a [[Xonthal's Tower|black stone tower]] at the base of [[Mount Hlim]] in the [[Savage Frontier]]. His apprentices and servants had homes built around the tower, in effect founding a [[Xonthal's Tower (village)|burgeoning village]] that would remain for at least a century later.

Around the {{YearlinkName|1306}}, Xonthal underwent an extreme shift in personality. He expelled his students from the tower, set deadly enchantments upon the hedge maze surrounding its entrance, and disappeared from public life.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: After his disappearance, some residents of Xonthal's Tower village believed the elusive archmage had died, or even underwent the process of [[lichdom]].
